    • addNotification

      public NotificationResponse addNotification​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, Body4 body) throws ApiException
      Create a new notification Create a new notification for a [resource](#section/Identifying-Resources) in your account. Notifications can be sent via email or webhook; - To enable email, pass an array of email addresses to the `recipients` parameter of this call. - To enable webhooks, setup the webhook callback URL in your account settings via [PATCH /account](#operation/updateAccount). **Notes:** - Authenticated user should have [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions)
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      body - (optional)
      Returns:
      NotificationResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • deleteNotificationById

      public EmptyResponse deleteNotificationById​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.Integer id) throws ApiException
      Delete a notification Deletes a notification. Note that deleting a notification _only_ deletes the notification &ndash; it does not delete any underlying files or folders. **Notes:** - You need to have the [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to update a notification. - You can only delete notifications owned by your user account.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the notification. Use [GET /notifications](#operation/listNotifications) if you need to lookup an ID. (required)
      Returns:
      EmptyResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • getNotificationById

      public NotificationResponse getNotificationById​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get notification details Get the details for a notification with a specific ID number. You'll be able to review its path, triggers and who's getting the notification. **Notes** - You need to have the [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to view the detail for a notification. - You can only retrieve notifications owned by your user account.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the notification. Use [GET /notifications](#operation/listNotifications) if you need to lookup an ID. (required)
      include - Related record types to include in the response. You can include multiple types by separating them with commas. Valid options are **ownerUser**, **resource**, and **share**. (optional)
      Returns:
      NotificationResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • listNotificationsCall

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call listNotificationsCall​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String type, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include, java.lang.String action, ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener, ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener) throws ApiException
      Build call for listNotifications
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      type - Type of notification include in the list. Valid options are **file**, **folder**, **send_receipt**, **share_receipt**, **file_drop** If this parameter is not used, only **file** and **folder** type notifications are included in the list. (optional)
      offset - Starting notification record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
      sort - What order the list of matches should be in. Valid sort fields are **resourcename**, **date**, **action** and **type**. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (-), in which case it will be descending. You can chose multiple options for the sort by separating them with commmas, such as \"type,-date\" to sort by type, then most recent. (optional)
      limit - Number of notification records to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional, default to 25)
      include - Related records to include in the response. Valid options are **ownerUser**, **resource**, **share** (optional)
      action - The kind of action which triggers the notification. Valid choices are **connect** (only for delivery receipts), **download**, **upload**, **delete**, or **all** **Note** The **all** action matches notifications set to \"all\", not all notifications. For example, notifications set to trigger only on delete are not included if you filter for action=all (optional)
      progressListener - Progress listener
      progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

    • listNotifications

      public NotificationCollectionResponse listNotifications​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String type, java.lang.Integer offset, java.lang.String sort, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.String include, java.lang.String action) throws ApiException
      Get a list of notifications Get a list of all the [notifications](/docs/account/06-notifications) you have access to. You can use sorting and filtering to limit the returned list. **Notes:** - Authenticated user should have [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions)
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      type - Type of notification include in the list. Valid options are **file**, **folder**, **send_receipt**, **share_receipt**, **file_drop** If this parameter is not used, only **file** and **folder** type notifications are included in the list. (optional)
      offset - Starting notification record in the result set. Can be used for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
      sort - What order the list of matches should be in. Valid sort fields are **resourcename**, **date**, **action** and **type**. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (-), in which case it will be descending. You can chose multiple options for the sort by separating them with commmas, such as \"type,-date\" to sort by type, then most recent. (optional)
      limit - Number of notification records to return. Can be used for pagination. (optional, default to 25)
      include - Related records to include in the response. Valid options are **ownerUser**, **resource**, **share** (optional)
      action - The kind of action which triggers the notification. Valid choices are **connect** (only for delivery receipts), **download**, **upload**, **delete**, or **all** **Note** The **all** action matches notifications set to \"all\", not all notifications. For example, notifications set to trigger only on delete are not included if you filter for action=all (optional)
      Returns:
      NotificationCollectionResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

You can chose multiple options for the sort by separating them with commmas, such as \"type,-date\" to sort by type, then most recent. (optional)

    • updateNotificationById

      public NotificationResponse updateNotificationById​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.Integer id, Body3 body) throws ApiException
      Update a notification Update an existing notification. You can add additional emails or change the action or users that cause a notification to trigger. When updating recipient emails, make sure your `recipients` parameter contains the full list of people who should be included on the notification. If you resend the list without an existing recipient, they will be deleted from the notification emails. **Notes:** - You need to have the [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to update a notification. - You can only change notifications owned by your user account.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the notification. Use [GET /notifications](#operation/listNotifications) if you need to lookup an ID. (required)
      body - (optional)
      Returns:
      NotificationResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • updateNotificationByIdWithHttpInfo

    • updateNotificationByIdAsync

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call updateNotificationByIdAsync​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.Integer id, Body3 body, ApiCallback<NotificationResponse> callback) throws ApiException
      Update a notification (asynchronously) Update an existing notification. You can add additional emails or change the action or users that cause a notification to trigger. When updating recipient emails, make sure your `recipients` parameter contains the full list of people who should be included on the notification. If you resend the list without an existing recipient, they will be deleted from the notification emails. **Notes:** - You need to have the [notifications permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) to update a notification. - You can only change notifications owned by your user account.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the notification. Use [GET /notifications](#operation/listNotifications) if you need to lookup an ID. (required)
      body - (optional)
      callback - The callback to be executed when the API call finishes
      Returns:
      The request call
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to process the API call, e.g. serializing the request body object
